trans-unit.source: How to Encode an Asset using Azure Media Encoder
trans-unit.target: How to Encode an Asset using Azure Media Encoder

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Media Encoder to encode media content on Media Services. Code samples use REST API.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Media Encoder to encode media content on Media Services. Code samples use REST API.

trans-unit.source: In order to deliver digital video over the internet you must compress the media.
trans-unit.target: In order to deliver digital video over the internet you must compress the media.

trans-unit.source: Digital video files are quite large and may be too big to deliver over the internet or for your customers’ devices to display properly.
trans-unit.target: Digital video files are quite large and may be too big to deliver over the internet or for your customers’ devices to display properly.

trans-unit.source: Encoding is the process of compressing video and audio so your customers can view your media.
trans-unit.target: Encoding is the process of compressing video and audio so your customers can view your media.

trans-unit.source: Encoding jobs are one of the most common processing operations in Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Encoding jobs are one of the most common processing operations in Media Services.

trans-unit.source: You create encoding jobs to convert media files from one encoding to another.
trans-unit.target: You create encoding jobs to convert media files from one encoding to another.

trans-unit.source: When you encode, you can use the Media Services built-in Media Encoder.
trans-unit.target: When you encode, you can use the Media Services built-in Media Encoder.

trans-unit.source: You can also use an encoder provided by a Media Services partner; third party encoders are available through the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: You can also use an encoder provided by a Media Services partner; third party encoders are available through the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the details of encoding tasks by using preset strings defined for your encoder, or by using preset configuration files.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the details of encoding tasks by using preset strings defined for your encoder, or by using preset configuration files.

trans-unit.source: To see the types of presets that are available, see <linkText>Task Presets for Azure Media Services</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To see the types of presets that are available, see <linkText>Task Presets for Azure Media Services</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you used a third party encoder, you should <linkText>validate your files</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you used a third party encoder, you should <linkText>validate your files</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Each Job can have one or more Tasks depending on the type of processing that you want to accomplish.
trans-unit.target: Each Job can have one or more Tasks depending on the type of processing that you want to accomplish.

trans-unit.source: Through the REST API, you can create Jobs and their related Tasks in one of two ways:
trans-unit.target: Through the REST API, you can create Jobs and their related Tasks in one of two ways:

trans-unit.source: Tasks can be defined inline through the Tasks navigation property on Job entities, or
trans-unit.target: Tasks can be defined inline through the Tasks navigation property on Job entities, or

trans-unit.source: through OData batch processing.
trans-unit.target: through OData batch processing.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to always encode your mezzanine files into an adaptive bitrate MP4 set and then convert the set to the desired format using the <linkText>Dynamic Packaging</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to always encode your mezzanine files into an adaptive bitrate MP4 set and then convert the set to the desired format using the <linkText>Dynamic Packaging</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you must first get at least one On-demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.
trans-unit.target: To take advantage of dynamic packaging, you must first get at least one On-demand streaming unit for the streaming endpoint from which you plan to delivery your content.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Scale Media Services](media-services-manage-origins.md#scalestreamingendpoints).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Scale Media Services](media-services-manage-origins.md#scalestreamingendpoints).

trans-unit.source: If your output asset is storage encrypted, you must configure asset delivery policy.
trans-unit.target: If your output asset is storage encrypted, you must configure asset delivery policy.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <linkText>Configuring asset delivery policy</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <linkText>Configuring asset delivery policy</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Before you start referencing media processors, verify that you have the correct media processor ID.
trans-unit.target: Before you start referencing media processors, verify that you have the correct media processor ID.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Get Media Processors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Get Media Processors</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When working with the Media Services REST API, the following considerations apply:
trans-unit.target: When working with the Media Services REST API, the following considerations apply:

trans-unit.source: When accessing entities in Media Services, you must set specific header fields and values in your HTTP requests.
trans-unit.target: When accessing entities in Media Services, you must set specific header fields and values in your HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Setup for Media Services REST API Development</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Setup for Media Services REST API Development</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After successfully connecting to https://media.windows.net, you will receive a 301 redirect specifying another Media Services URI.
trans-unit.target: After successfully connecting to https://media.windows.net, you will receive a 301 redirect specifying another Media Services URI.

trans-unit.source: You must make subsequent calls to the new URI as described in <linkText>Connecting to Media Services using REST API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You must make subsequent calls to the new URI as described in <linkText>Connecting to Media Services using REST API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows you how to create and post a Job with one Task set to encode a video at a specific resolution and quality.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows you how to create and post a Job with one Task set to encode a video at a specific resolution and quality.

trans-unit.source: When encoding with Azure Media Encoder, you can use task configuration presets specified <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: When encoding with Azure Media Encoder, you can use task configuration presets specified <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Request:
trans-unit.target: Request:

trans-unit.source: Response:
trans-unit.target: Response:

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to set the assetName attribute:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to set the assetName attribute:

trans-unit.source: TaskBody properties MUST use literal XML to define the number of input, or output assets that will be used by the Task.
trans-unit.target: TaskBody properties MUST use literal XML to define the number of input, or output assets that will be used by the Task.

trans-unit.source: The Task topic contains the XML Schema Definition for the XML.
trans-unit.target: The Task topic contains the XML Schema Definition for the XML.

trans-unit.source: In the TaskBody definition, each inner value for <inputAsset> and <outputAsset> must be set as JobInputAsset(value) or JobOutputAsset(value).
trans-unit.target: In the TaskBody definition, each inner value for <inputAsset> and <outputAsset> must be set as JobInputAsset(value) or JobOutputAsset(value).

trans-unit.source: A task can have multiple output assets.
trans-unit.target: A task can have multiple output assets.

trans-unit.source: One JobOutputAsset(x) can only be used once as an output of a task in a job.
trans-unit.target: One JobOutputAsset(x) can only be used once as an output of a task in a job.

trans-unit.source: You can specify JobInputAsset or JobOutputAsset as an input asset of a task.
trans-unit.target: You can specify JobInputAsset or JobOutputAsset as an input asset of a task.

trans-unit.source: Tasks must not form a cycle.
trans-unit.target: Tasks must not form a cycle.

trans-unit.source: The value parameter that you pass to JobInputAsset or JobOutputAsset represents the index value for an Asset.
trans-unit.target: The value parameter that you pass to JobInputAsset or JobOutputAsset represents the index value for an Asset.

trans-unit.source: The actual Assets are defined in the InputMediaAssets and OutputMediaAssets navigation properties on the Job entity definition.
trans-unit.target: The actual Assets are defined in the InputMediaAssets and OutputMediaAssets navigation properties on the Job entity definition.

trans-unit.source: Because Media Services is built on OData v3, the individual assets in InputMediaAssets and OutputMediaAssets navigation property collections are referenced through a "__metadata : uri" name-value pair.
trans-unit.target: Because Media Services is built on OData v3, the individual assets in InputMediaAssets and OutputMediaAssets navigation property collections are referenced through a "__metadata : uri" name-value pair.

trans-unit.source: InputMediaAssets maps to one or more Assets you have created in Media Services.
trans-unit.target: InputMediaAssets maps to one or more Assets you have created in Media Services.

trans-unit.source: OutputMediaAssets are created by the system.
trans-unit.target: OutputMediaAssets are created by the system.

trans-unit.source: They do not reference an existing asset.
trans-unit.target: They do not reference an existing asset.

trans-unit.source: OutputMediaAssets can be named using the assetName attribute. If this attribute is not present, then the name of the OutputMediaAsset will be whatever the inner text value of the <outputAsset> element is with a suffix of either the Job Name value, or the Job Id value (in the case where the Name property isn't defined). For example, if you set a value for assetName to "Sample", then the OutputMediaAsset Name property would be set to "Sample". However, if you did not set a value for assetName, but did set the job name to "NewJob", then the OutputMediaAsset Name would be "JobOutputAsset(value)_NewJob".
trans-unit.target: OutputMediaAssets can be named using the assetName attribute. If this attribute is not present, then the name of the OutputMediaAsset will be whatever the inner text value of the <outputAsset> element is with a suffix of either the Job Name value, or the Job Id value (in the case where the Name property isn't defined). For example, if you set a value for assetName to "Sample", then the OutputMediaAsset Name property would be set to "Sample". However, if you did not set a value for assetName, but did set the job name to "NewJob", then the OutputMediaAsset Name would be "JobOutputAsset(value)_NewJob".

trans-unit.source: In many application scenarios, developers want to create a series of processing tasks.
trans-unit.target: In many application scenarios, developers want to create a series of processing tasks.

trans-unit.source: In Media Services, you can create a series of chained tasks.
trans-unit.target: In Media Services, you can create a series of chained tasks.

trans-unit.source: Each task performs different processing steps and can use different media processors.
trans-unit.target: Each task performs different processing steps and can use different media processors.

trans-unit.source: The chained tasks can hand off an asset from one task to another, performing a linear sequence of tasks on the asset.
trans-unit.target: The chained tasks can hand off an asset from one task to another, performing a linear sequence of tasks on the asset.

trans-unit.source: However, the tasks performed in a job are not required to be in a sequence.
trans-unit.target: However, the tasks performed in a job are not required to be in a sequence.

trans-unit.source: When you create a chained task, the chained ITask objects are created in a single IJob object.
trans-unit.target: When you create a chained task, the chained ITask objects are created in a single IJob object.

trans-unit.source: There is currently a limit of 30 tasks per job.
trans-unit.target: There is currently a limit of 30 tasks per job.

trans-unit.source: If you need to chain more than 30 tasks, create more than one job to contain the tasks.
trans-unit.target: If you need to chain more than 30 tasks, create more than one job to contain the tasks.

trans-unit.source: To enable task chaining:
trans-unit.target: To enable task chaining:

trans-unit.source: A job must have at least 2 tasks
trans-unit.target: A job must have at least 2 tasks

trans-unit.source: There must be at least one task whose input is output of another task in the job.
trans-unit.target: There must be at least one task whose input is output of another task in the job.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to use OData batch processing to create a job and tasks.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to use OData batch processing to create a job and tasks.

trans-unit.source: For information on batch processing, see <linkText>Open Data Protocol (OData) Batch Processing</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information on batch processing, see <linkText>Open Data Protocol (OData) Batch Processing</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When processing multiple Assets using a common set of Tasks, JobTemplates are useful to specify the default Task presets, order of Tasks, and so on.
trans-unit.target: When processing multiple Assets using a common set of Tasks, JobTemplates are useful to specify the default Task presets, order of Tasks, and so on.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to create a JobTemplate with a TaskTemplate defined inline.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to create a JobTemplate with a TaskTemplate defined inline.

trans-unit.source: The TaskTemplate uses the Azure Media Encoder as the MediaProcessor to encode the Asset file; however, other MediaProcessors could be used as well.
trans-unit.target: The TaskTemplate uses the Azure Media Encoder as the MediaProcessor to encode the Asset file; however, other MediaProcessors could be used as well.

trans-unit.source: Unlike other Media Services entities, you must define a new GUID identifier for each TaskTemplate and place it in the taskTemplateId and Id property in your request body.
trans-unit.target: Unlike other Media Services entities, you must define a new GUID identifier for each TaskTemplate and place it in the taskTemplateId and Id property in your request body.

trans-unit.source: The content identification scheme must follow the scheme described in Identify Azure Media Services Entities.
trans-unit.target: The content identification scheme must follow the scheme described in Identify Azure Media Services Entities.

trans-unit.source: Also, JobTemplates cannot be updated.
trans-unit.target: Also, JobTemplates cannot be updated.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you must create a new one with your updated changes.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you must create a new one with your updated changes.

trans-unit.source: If successful, the following response is returned:
trans-unit.target: If successful, the following response is returned:

trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to create a Job referencing a JobTemplate Id:

trans-unit.target: If successful, the following response is returned:

trans-unit.source: Now that you know how to create a job to encode an assset, go to the <linkText>How To Check Job Progress with Media Services</linkText><title></title> topic.
trans-unit.target: Now that you know how to create a job to encode an assset, go to the <linkText>How To Check Job Progress with Media Services</linkText><title></title> topic.
